version_description: Heart rate icon during training was missing from Apple Watch users with OS 2.0, this is now fixed.
HR sensor pairing has been fixed.
HR sensor pairing has been fixed.
Updated Polar Beat App featuring Training Guidance and new, sleek design.
Fixed the issue that the screen doesn’t stay on during your training session and other minor bug fixes.
Fixes a bug where training sessions with GPS data were synced as incomplete to Flow service in certain cases.
Improved sharing feature: now you can share your own images with training data.

Polar Beat 2.2 offers:
- App and Voice guidance in 15 new languages Czech, Danish, Dutch, Finnish, French, Indonesian, Italian, Korean, Norwegian, Polish, Portuguese, Russian, Simplified Chinese, Swedish, Turkish
- Search functionality when changing sport
- Secure Pause Button during training
For this release, sync stability was improved and several minor bug fixes were made, including a fix for running index in mi/h speed view.
With this release, we fixed minor bugs to improve the quality of the Beat app.

◆ POLAR H10 HR SENSOR COMPATIBILITY
Do you prefer doing non-GPS training sessions without your phone? With the latest Polar H10 HR sensor, you can track your heart rate during your workout and transfer your heart rate data to Polar Beat afterwards. (Top tip: great for swimming!)
Fixes to improve quality, e.g. distance was missing from some exercises.

Tired of chest straps, but still want to follow your heart rate during your workouts? This update makes Polar A370’s OHR sensor mode available to all Polar Beat users who have a Polar A370. Mount your phone with Polar Beat on a bike, wear your Polar A370, and follow the live heart rate recordings without a chest strap.

◆ POLAR OH1 COMPATIBILITY
Yippee, this release brings compatibility for our brand-new Polar OH1 optical heart rate sensor. Polar OH1 tracks heart rate with Polar’s high-quality optical HR solution and transfers data via Bluetooth. Go to polar.com/oh1 to find out more!
This release brings quality improvements for the Polar Beat app.
This release brings support for iPhone X. Additionally, we fixed an issue that caused heart rate dropouts when using Polar H10 with the Polar Beat app. Happy training :)
With this release, we fixed minor bugs to improve the quality of the Beat app.
This release brings the quality improvements for the Polar Beat app.
With this release, we fixed minor bugs to improve the quality of the Beat app.
We’ve smashed a few bugs to improve your experience of using the Beat app. Happy training! :)

◆ NEW LES MILLS SPORT PROFILE
Are you ready for a modern version of classic balletic training? LES MILLS BARRE™ sport profile is now available on Polar Beat! It may look beautiful, but don’t underestimate the burn! Also, LES MILLS BODYVIVE™ sport profile changed to LES MILLS TONE™.

Additionally, we’ve smashed a few bugs to improve your experience using the Beat app. Happy training! :)

◆UPDATED PRIVACY NOTICE AND TERMS OF USE
Polar Beat is all about your training and hard work—moreover, your data. We want to be transparent in everything that we do, so we have updated our Privacy Notice and Terms of Use for Polar Beat.

Additionally, we’ve smashed a few bugs to improve your experience using the Beat app. Happy training! :)

◆ UNLOCK PREMIUM FEATURES WITH POLAR HR SENSOR
Your Polar Bluetooth heart rate sensor is now your all-access pass to Polar Beat’s premium features: Fitness Test, Running Index, EnergyPointer and Benefit Target! Turn your phone into a fitness tracker that gives you smarter training guidance and helps you reach all your fitness goals.
This release brings the quality improvements for the Polar Beat app.

As we continue further development and improvements of the Polar Beat app, from this release we only support devices with iOS 12 or newer. If you're using iOS 11, you can continue using the app, but no new updates will be released on your device. We encourage iOS 11 users to upgrade to iOS 12 or newer to ensure receiving the latest updates and features.

◆ TWO SIMULTANEOUS BLUETOOTH CONNECTIONS TO POLAR H10
TWO are better than ONE! Have you been thinking of transmitting heart rate from your Polar H10 to both Polar Beat app and your Bluetooth-compatible gym equipment? From now on, it’s possible to establish two simultaneous Bluetooth connections to Polar H10.

Additionally, we’ve smashed a few bugs to improve your experience using the Beat app. Happy training! :)
We’ve smashed a few bugs to improve your experience of using the Beat app. Happy training! :)

Ho-ho-ho, the holiday season is right around the corner and Santa decided to bring an early present to Polar Beat—the app has a new icon now.

Additionally, we’ve smashed a few bugs to improve your experience using the Beat app. Happy training! :)
We’ve smashed a few bugs to improve your experience using the Polar Beat app. Happy training :)
If you’ve had trouble using the Polar Beat app in French, Norwegian and simplified Chinese while pairing Polar H10 or Polar H7, this release brings a fix for that.
This release brings quality improvements to the Polar Beat app.

◆ FULLY PHONE-LESS EXPERIENCE WITH POLAR OH1
Turn your workouts into your phone-free me-time! From now on you can go phoneless with your Polar OH1 and Polar Beat. Leave your phone into the locker and track your beats with OH1. After the session all your data syncs conveniently to Beat app.

Additionally, we’ve smashed a few bugs to improve your experience using the Beat app. Happy training! :)

Always stay up-to-date with the latest Polar Beat app releases – from now on, you’ll get a notification inside the app once a new version is available for update.

Additionally, we’ve smashed a few bugs to improve your experience using the Beat app. Happy training!

◆ POLAR H10 ANT+ COMPATIBILITY
Connection options with Polar H10 are about to be multiplied – now you can use it with ANT+ devices, such as cycling computers or gym equipment. To get the ANT+ functionality to your H10, simply update it to the latest firmware version using the Polar Beat app.

Additionally, we’ve smashed a few bugs to improve your experience using the Beat app. Happy training!
This release brings quality improvements to the Polar Beat app.
We’ve smashed a few bugs to improve your experience of using the Beat app. Happy training! :)

This release brings quality improvements to the Polar Beat app.
We've improved compatibility with iOS 13 and smashed a few bugs. Happy training! :)

◆ POLAR BLOG SECTION
Are you an ambitious athlete who loves sports, sweat and data? Read the latest inspiring athlete stories and tried and tested pro tips on training, racing and recovery straight from the ‘Blog’ section in the Polar Beat app.
If you’ve had trouble downloading standalone Polar H10 session to the Polar Beat app, this update brings a fix for that.

As we continue further development and improvements of the Polar Beat app, from this release we only support devices with iOS 12 or newer. If you're using iOS 11, you can continue using the app, but no new updates will be released on your device. We encourage iOS 11 users to upgrade to iOS 12 or newer to ensure receiving the latest updates and features.

Get connected & get going – this release brings compatibility for our brand new Polar H9 heart rate sensor. H9 gets you reliable high quality heart rate tracking for all your everyday sports. Go to polar.com/h9 to find out more!
This release brings bug fixes to the Polar Beat app.
This release brings bug fixes to the Polar Beat app.
This release brings bug fixes to the Polar Beat app.

New languages now supported in Polar Blog: French and Deutsch. If you are using your phone in one of these languages, the 'Blog' section in the Polar Beat app will automatically switch to a new language.
Polar Blog is now available in Spanish. If you are using your phone in Spanish, the 'Blog' section in the app will automatically switch to the new language.
